meanings.definition: A person who talks incessantly and often trivially.
meanings.sent1: The chatterbox in our class never stops talking.
meanings.sent2: My little sister is a chatterbox who never runs out of things to say.
meanings.sent3: The chatterbox at the party kept everyone entertained with their stories.
meanings.sent4: Her parrot was a chatterbox, mimicking every word she said.
meanings.sent5: The chatterbox's non-stop chatter filled the room with noise.

meanings.definition: To talk rapidly, incessantly, and trivially.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, she would chatterbox about her weekend plans.
meanings.sent2: When excited, my friend tends to chatterbox without taking a breath.
meanings.sent3: I had to chatterbox my way through the presentation due to nerves.
meanings.sent4: The birds outside my window chatterbox every morning, waking me up.
meanings.sent5: As the auctioneer began to chatterbox, the bids started flying in.
